Module contents

class src.Spamfilter(training_dir)[source]

Bases: object

A naive Bayesian spam filter

classify(filepath)[source]

classifies a file as spam or ham based on training data :param filepath: :return: (boolean) True->spam, False->ham

classify_all(dir_path, known_type='spam')[source]

Classifies all emails in a testing directory and maintains count of errors :param dir_path: path of testing directory :param known_type: str: the known type of testing directory

clean_table(min_freq)[source]

Removes entries from frequency table if they are deemed poor indicators. or if combined spam/ham frequency is below ‘min_freq’ :param min_freq: if total token count below threshold, delete from table

create_frequency_table()[source]

Generates token frequency table from training emails :return: dict{k,v}: spam/ham frequencies k = (str)token, v = {spam_freq: , ham_freq:, prob_spam:, prob_ham:}

print_table_info()[source]

Print training info: - unique tokens in ham and spam, number of emails in training set

prob_ham(token)[source]

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in ham emails :param token: (str) :return: (float) probability ‘token’ is ham based on training emails

prob_msg_ham(filepath)[source]

Calculates the probability that a message is ham :param filepath: (str) path of email :return: (float) probability message is ham

prob_msg_spam(filepath)[source]

Calculates the probability that a message is spam :param filepath: (str) path of email :return: (float) probability message is spam

prob_spam(token)[source]

calculates the probability that ‘token’ is found in spam emails :param token: (str) :return: (float) probability ‘token’ is spam based on training emails

src.clean_split(in_str)[source]

Removes all non-alphanum chars and splits string at whitespace, downcase :param in_str: (str) target string :return: (list) cleaned strings

src.dir_tokens(dir_path)[source]

tokenizes all files contained in ‘dir_path’ :param dir_path: directory containing files to be tokenized :return: list of tokens

src.file_tokens(filepath)[source]

tokenizes all strings contained in ‘filepath’ after removing all non-alphanum chars and splitting strings at whitespace :param filepath: path of target file :return: list of tokens

src.tokens(text, tok_size=3)[source]

Returns a list of all substrings contained in ‘text’ of size ‘tok_size’ :param text: (string) text to tokenize :param tok_size: length of substrings :return: (list) tokens of ‘text’
